Today, I attended an event for the Housing and Community Development Network of NJ to promote more federal funding for affordable housing.  I fight to promote more affordable housing every day and I enjoyed a chance to support this great cause. https://t.co/z3mDZZx5Zx

Joyce Watterman was the first African-American woman elected as Council President of Jersey City.  She is the founder of Women Working Together for Change, an organization that empowers women, and the H.O.P.E. Summer program for children.  #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/uI1cx7fyZN

February is National Self-Check Month.  More than half of American adults could suffer from heart disease or have a stroke in their lifetime.  But there is a way to perform a self-check to avoid these health issues.  For more information, visit: https://t.co/wkFEafEFWq https://t.co/sA6PFtC21a

Ras Baraka is the Mayor of Newark and a graduate of Howard University.  He has implemented various programs in the city that have reduced crime, reimagined public safety, and tackled the city’s housing crisis.  #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/waulzJevFQ

Summer Jones is a Village Trustee for South Orange and the Chair of Recreation, Arts, and Cultural Affairs for the Trustee Committee.  Also, she serves as the Assistant Vice President of Montclair State University’s Division of Information Technology.  #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/bay5Z9quM1

Shaquille O'Neal, one of the greatest players in NBA history, was born and raised in Newark.  He won four NBA championships, three Finals MVP awards and one regular-season MVP trophy.  Shaq is a 15-time NBA All-Star and an eight-time all-NBA first-team selection. #EssexCounty https://t.co/PdptXh1zu5
Mayor Dwayne D. Warren is the Mayor of the City of Orange Township and a graduate of the Rutgers University School of Law.  #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/0DcmsTDQYi

February is National Self-Check Month.  More than half of American adults could suffer from heart disease or have a stroke in their lifetime.  But there is a way to perform a self-check to avoid these health issues.  For more information, visit: https://t.co/wkFEafEFWq https://t.co/bqLpUpZw6n
Ted Green is the Mayor of East Orange, a former graduate of East Orange High School, and a lifelong resident of the city. #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/zlKNudkcYH
Dahlia Vertreese is the Mayor of Hillside and a previous member of the Hillside Board of Education.  She is a public servant at heart.   #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/Wtk1bTdx4G
Happy Valentine's Day to the N.J. 10th Congressional District! https://t.co/hhbMVkpnYg
Kenneth Gibson was the first Black Mayor of Newark and later became the first Black President of the U.S. Conference of Mayors. #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/HF5XHvopz6

Tony Vauss has served as the Mayor of Irvington since 2014.  Previously, he was a public officer for the Irvington Board of Education and a member of the Martin Luther King Heritage Committee, National Action Network, and the N.A.A.C.P. #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/edh8Fj6BvN

My uncle, William D. Payne, was the first African American to own a paper manufacturing business in the Northeast.  In addition, he served in the New Jersey Assembly from 1998 to 2008. #NJ10thBlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/CJv1HiuEDj

Today, I joined VP Kamala Harris and NJ’s local and national leaders in Newark to celebrate the lead service line removal project.  I fought for funding and introduced bills to protect drinking water in our district and nationwide in Congress.  This is a GREAT day for Newark!! https://t.co/nyaffErgvJ

Cheryl “Kit” Turner is the Founder & CEO of New Hope Village 4 Veterans.  She works tirelessly to combat the food insecurity of our nations’ veterans.  Her organization has distributed more than 63,000 meals to veterans and 663 toys to children-in-need during the holiday season. https://t.co/48RTDUCO8n

Electric vehicles are the future and a critical way to reduce carbon pollution. Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law that I supported New Jersey will receive $15.4 million to invest in EV charging infrastructure this year for #ElectrifyingAmerica. https://t.co/GvJVfpfrf2

James and Carol Wallace started The International Youth Organization in 1984.  James was a Newark fireman and Newark Special Police officer who founded the organization to give young adults a “route” off the streets to improve their lives.  For more info,  https://t.co/QoFwo0jVG1

Dr. Chris Pernell is the 1st Chief Strategic Integration and Health Equity Officer at Newark's University Hospital and the Clinical Assistant Professor at Rutgers New Jersey Medical School.  She's an East Orange native who graduated cum laude from Princeton University. https://t.co/VAwDufnGct

Today, I invited all the mayors in the 10th Congressional District to a forum to discuss the federal funds available in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act.   It was great to hear about their projects and I will continue to fight to make sure they get funded. https://t.co/pkGxAIJwT8

For months, I've heard constituent complaints about issues with the Postal Service.  Today, I helped pass a bill to restore the Postal Service to the previous standards of excellence for all New Jersey residents, including delivery of mail and packages six days per week. https://t.co/2q9PGRkemD

George Richardson was a civil rights leader who fought against segregation in housing, public schools, and local zoning laws.  In 1961, he was elected to the New Jersey Legislature and passed a bill to end housing segregation.  He served four terms in the Legislature. https://t.co/S6SOpMJGft

60 million Americans have signed away their rights in forced arbitration clauses at work -- and many don’t even know it. Today, we passed legislation to #EndForcedArbitration so that survivors of sexual assault & harassment aren’t blocked from seeking justice. https://t.co/f9VHgtquE2

Sheila Oliver is a history-making politician from Newark.  She was the Speaker of the New Jersey General Assembly before she was the first African-American woman elected to be Lt. Governor in New Jersey’s history and the first to be elected to a statewide position ever. https://t.co/0caDkfksoG

Melvin Randolph “Randy” Primas, Jr. was elected to the Camden City Council when he was just 23 years old and later became City Council President.  In 1981, he was elected to be the first African-American Mayor of Camden when he was 31 years old. https://t.co/yJ5MYqM8a2
Willie B. Brown represented Newark in the NJ State Assembly from 1974 to 1998.  In 1988, he became the second Black lawmaker to serve as Assembly Minority Leader. https://t.co/hERM3kwTFt

I strongly believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect.  I was proud to receive a 100% score from The Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights for my votes to support bills that promote equality.  

https://t.co/euUewLlR62 https://t.co/R0b1Mo3Bt0

William S. Hart, Sr. was the first Black elected to East Orange City Council in 1959.  Ten years later, he was elected the first Black Mayor of East Orange, NJ and later served as President of the National Black Caucus of Local Elected Officials. https://t.co/5Syn1sjBlq

Today is #WorldCancer Day.  I have been a strong supporter of efforts to fight cancer since my father, Congressman Donald M. Payne, Sr., died of colorectal cancer.  We must support President Biden's Cancer Moonshot program to increase cancer survival rates for all Americans. https://t.co/UMWNnxGWEy
#AmericaCOMPETES will enable America to lead the world in semiconductor manufacturing and ensure domestic automakers and defense manufacturers have access to critical chips. https://t.co/6LydFv9FUj
I’ve always been pro-labor. I’ve been in two labor unions in my working career.  I’m proud of my 100% union voting record, and I support everyone’s right to organize! https://t.co/zqf1Do7XTt
Guy R. Moorhead became the first Black Democrat to win a seat in the New Jersey State Assembly in 1936. https://t.co/6EX4uKS0LE

I joined President Biden's Cancer Moonshot event today to cut cancer deaths 50% in 25 years.  I've worked to increase cancer survival rates since the death of my father, Congressman Donald M. Payne, Sr.  This project will save millions of lives in the future.  #CancerMoonshot https://t.co/AaNzhxbRix

I helped pass the No Surprises Act to protect Americans from unexpected medical bills from out-of-network providers.  The new law bans surprise billing for most emergency care and provides health care cost information to uninsured and self-pay patients. https://t.co/kDT6BpAJ5p
Gun violence is a national tragedy that claims more than 110 Americans every day.  We need to do more to stop these preventable deaths.  #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/vkphECvFYC

Today is Groundhog Day!  

Unfortunately, Punxsutawney Phil saw his shadow this morning, which means six more weeks of winter.

https://t.co/rqn7KshkHi https://t.co/sBUtnROvSz

Congressman Donald M. Payne, Sr. was the first African American to represent New Jersey in Congress and an outstanding representative of our 10th District.  Also, he was a great father and mentor to me. https://t.co/6giiepJjS2

February is Black History Month.  It’s an important time to highlight the accomplishments of African Americans in our community.  I will be celebrating the work of local African Americans throughout the month to honor their work and legacy. https://t.co/EzaY5LSzD1
This month, we honor all the contributions African-Americans have made and continue to make in America. https://t.co/T7bqSskb30

This week is National Gun Violence Survivor's Week.  It is time to remember the thousands of Americans that have lost loved ones to Gun Violence.  RT to add your voice to our fight to save lives. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/xkA2fcDYyl

#ElectricVehicles are vital tools in our fight against #ClimateChange, but we must ensure the infrastructure to charge these vehicles is available to everyone. That’s why the #BuildBackBetter Act invests in a publicly accessible Electric Vehicle charging network. https://t.co/00HAeptm7U

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill will create good-paying jobs and invest in American workers and communities – rebuilding our infrastructure while helping rebuild the middle class. https://t.co/oX5noG7VNo

America needs to use more energy-saving technologies to save money, protect the environment, and compete in the global economy.  The Infrastructure bill includes $104 billion to expand the nation’s electrical vehicle charging network to make electric car charging easier. https://t.co/mlyb3bbmRr

The #BuildBackBetter Act will benefit Americans in every Congressional district with more affordable childcare and lower drug prices.
